p: B. laterosporus, P. alvei, P. dendritiformis and M. plutonius were the most sensitive bacteria (IC 50 mostly <1000 ppm, even <500 ppm in more than 75% of the cases) (Fig. 1). Comparable response patterns at low sensitivity were observed for the Gram-negative bacteria E. coli and P. fluorescens. B. pumilus and E. faecalis formed an additional cluster in Fig. 1 due to their high terpene resistance, in particular against geraniol, linalool, α-terpineol and trans-sabinene hydrate.
